summary:
I am result driven and have a passion for non-food quality management processes. 

I am truly passionate about my work and I believe successful teams are built on trust, responsibility and ownership. I am at my best collaborating with others. It is my goal to drive the business forward by constantly implementing small changes and big improvements which enable us to better service our customers. Colleagues know me as determined, dedicated, analytical and objectively critical.

profile_positions.description:
Together with retailers, L creates loyalty programs for today and tomorrow. We want to enrich life for the many. And give everyone the opportunity to collect things in life that put a smile on their face. People that feel good are the essence of loyalty. The best currency to build a strong relationship between companies and customers.

Over 30 years ago, our founders created their first loyalty concept that travelled across the globe.
Together we share over 1200 years of experience in loyalty. Loyalty is in our DNA, we understand loyalty. That’s why we are the founders of loyalty. We now want to use all our experience to move the loyalty business forward. By creating new concepts, ideas, technologies and products. We set new standards in loyalty.
profile_positions.title: Founder | Quality Director

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the business unit non-food  with the lead quality management consultancy in the Netherlands. Our team consisted of 21 non-food quality experts. We supported well-know retail brands, product developers and importers in their quality management process by providing tailor made training, consultancy or outsourcing solutions. Together with our customers we designed the roadmap to fullfilling their quality ambitions.

In addition to this role I was part of the Précon Consulting Group management team. In this team my focus areas were Sales, Marketing and IT.

Key contributions
-	Guided the transformation of the former Blokker holding QA department to the leading Dutch consultancy team for non-food quality management
-	Widend non-food customer base with three digit figures 
-	Increased non-food turnover with doubled digit figures
- 	Increased commercial awareness and focus within the Précon Consulting Group
profile_positions.title: Business Unit Manager Non-food QA

profile_positions.description:
Transformed all of Blokker Holdings QA/QC teams from a entirely decentralized structure to a fully integrated corporate Shared Service Center. Selected, built, developed, and led the corporate QA/QC team. The team consists of 4 QA experts and 14 QA/QC team members. 

Designed and developed a tailor made QA/QC workflow application with supplier portals which connects SKU’s and PO-lines to requirements lists and allows suppliers to submit their product safety compliance documentation for review. 

Worked closely with members of the Board and the Managing Directors of the retail brands to develop processes that rapidly increased the awareness of the need for regulatory compliance among internal and external stakeholders. Transformed the relation with market surveillance authorities from a decentralised authoritarian surveillance per retail brand to a cooperative surveillance on corporate level by continuously pursuing QA/QC-processes based on data, transparency, cooperation and frequent communication with all stakeholders.

Extended the scope of the QA/QC activities from merely regulatory compliance to integrated product quality and the development of private label lines. Initiated participation in BSCI and ICTI for all retail brands. Increased the number of annually handled new SKU from approx. 9,000 to over 100,000 (2013 -2016) whilst decreasing the original staffing by more than 30%. On behalf of approx. 90 category managers the QA/QC team annually services more than 1,100 suppliers and manufacturers worldwide.

The scope included 9 retail brands (Bart Smit, Big Bazar, Blokker, Intertoys, Leen Bakker, Marskramer, ToysXL, Tuincentrum Overvecht en Xenos) and 2 wholesale brands (Elektroblok, Trend Center) operating in the Netherlands, Belgium, Luxembourg and Germany.
profile_positions.title: Quality Manager & Manager Shared Service Center Quality Assurance

profile_positions.description:

Main responsibilties included;  providing leadership, trouble shooting; restructuring processes, tasks and responsibilities in the team, redefining the activity scope with other departments, preparing the team for the upcoming merger,  enabling the team to meet their stock availibility targets during the critical retail season (Oct - Dec 2015).

 Worked closely with Big Bazar’s sourcing agent to develop QA/ QC protocols to enable them to source compliant suppliers and manfacturers more efficiently.

Continuously trained the buying department on the pitfalls of product compliance. Developed proper relations with all market surveillance authorities.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager Quality Department

profile_positions.description:
Selected, built and led a 10 member QA/QC team.  Processed a legacy of product compliance files, reports and legal issues of multiple years within 24 months. 

Protected Blokker’s reputation through managing over a dozen recalls in this period; introduced a programm on collecting and processing customer complaints related to potential product safety issues. Restored the relations with all market surveillance authorities to a working level.

Worked closely with Blokker’s main Far East buying agents to develop QA/ QC protocols to enable them to source compliant suppliers and manufacturers more efficiently. Introduced QC protocols for all EU based suppliers. Developed standardised product safety protocols and testing rates with SGS, Bureau Veritas, Dekra, Intertek and TüV.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager Quality Department

profile_positions.description:
Led teams responsible for Master Data Management, Order & Delivery Control,  Quality Assurance &  Quality Control, Import and push-driven promotional distribution and promotional pricing. All teams supported the 300 store retail operation in the Netherlands, Belgium and Germany. 

In addition continued to act as the quality assurance expert and single point of contact for all market surveillance authorities in the Netherlands, Belgium and Germany.
profile_positions.title: Manager Bedrijfsbureau

profile_positions.description:
Integrated all support processes and staff of the 5 buying department into a new department: Bedrijfsbureau. This secured the availability of sufficient, well trained buying support staff which ensured the continous operation of all buying departments. Before gaps in staffing at a department led to loss of quality of process and quality of services in form of partial business stand stills, needless overtime, increasing work pressure and lost deals. The integration of all support staff increased overall buying support efficiency which resulted in reduced processing and throughput times.

Designed and sucessfully implemented a compliance management system. Redesigned sourcing and buying processes to ensure they meet compliance requirements. Recognized as best practice within Blokker Holding. Dutch Market Surveillance Authorities:  Inspectie Leefomgeving en Transport (ILT) and Nederlandse Voedsel- en Warenautoriteit recognized the consistently high performance level of this product compliance management system by jointly entering into covention on surveillance with the Intertoys board.

Designed and implemented sales, supply chain and finance processes for a new business model: Intertoys Wholesale. Serviced wholesale customers in Czech Republic, Slovakia, Romania, the Netherlands Antilles and Spain.

Quality assurance expert and single point of contact for all market surveillance authorities  covering the entire assortment of the 300 store retail operation in the Netherlands, Belgium and Germany.
